qas.question: Who rebuilt the abbey for a burial church?
What style was the church rebuilt in?
When did King Edward the Confessor die?
Who was the first documented coronation?
What architectural design wasn't St Peter's abbey considered?
What year was the building started?
What was the date of the Abbey's demolition?
Who was the last recorded coronation at the Abbey?
What King restored the Abbey in the years 1042 and 1062?

context: Between 1042 and 1052 <a0_0><b9_0>King Edward the Confessor<b9_0/><a0_0/> began rebuilding St Peter's Abbey to provide himself with a royal burial church. It was the first church in England built in the <a1_0><b5_0>Romanesque<a1_0/> style<b5_0/>. The building was not completed until around <b6_0>1090<b6_0/> but was consecrated on <a2_0><b7_0>28 December 1065<b7_0/><a2_0/>, only a week before Edward's death on <a3_0>5 January 1066<a3_0/>. A week later he was buried in the church, and nine years later his wife Edith was buried alongside him. His successor, Harold II, was probably crowned in the abbey, although the first documented coronation is that of <a4_0><b8_0>William the Conqueror<b8_0/><a4_0/> later the same year.
